reviewText:
WARNING: This game will not work if run through Steam. It only works through compatibility mode with Windows XP Service Pack 3.

THE FOLLOWING METHOD IS ONLY PROVEN TO WORK IN WINDOWS 7.

Launching the game:
1.Right-click game in Steam Library.
2.Click Properties, then in new window click on the local files tab.
3.Click 'Browse Local Files'.
4.Windows explorer should pop up with the game files. Right click on Antanta.exe (shown as Antanta).
5.Click properties again, then in new window navigate to compatibility tab.
6.Tick the box where it's description is: Run this game in compatibility mode for.....
7.Select Windows XP Service Pack 3.
8.Click apply, then launch Antanta.exe or play through Steam.
9.Your game should boot properly with minor graphical bugs (which go away and are only in the levels).

Errors:
-Game seems to blackscreen whenever you select something in the menus, but it only remains for 2-5 seconds.
-Minor graphical bugs on ore deposits, fixed when player makes an action.

I will update this post the more bugs and errors I find. I know this isn't a review, but it is something nesscessary considering all the negative reviews. Please, reccommend this so others can see (if it works for you).
voteText: 74 of 89 people (83%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Do not buy this game.

An excellent looking game for those interested in the Cossack/American Conquest style engines, HOWEVER:

The game simply will not work on newer operating systems, i.e. Windows 8. The developers have no interest at all in responding the these concerns, rather content to milk each new purchaser for its garbage price of $0.49.
As someone who used to play this title, I am dissapointed in the Steam release, dysfunctional as it is.

reviewText: Ok for the price, this game is great! Sure it‚Äôs not that smooth and the controls are kinda wonky. But other than that it‚Äôs pretty solid. The AI isn‚Äôt too bad and the Historical accuracy is quite impressive.  It has enough variety unit wise to make for a nice mixed combat. Not to mention it has both air and sea units.  The graphics aren‚Äôt the best, but they will do. I don‚Äôt see why any strategy enthusiast shouldn‚Äôt play this game.

reviewText:
This game may not work on your machine so beware!
The Entente is a Real-time strategy game revolves around World War I and is based on the military events from 1914 to 1918. Players must gather resources that include food, wood, iron, gold, oil and electricity to create and feed their nation and armies of World War I.

The game runs on Cossacks game engine, and is similar to Cossacks/American Conquest series in some ways, the game is overall very unique and fun but has compatibility problems with new hardware and operating systems.

Pros:
-Good old Isometric graphics similar to Cossacks/American Conquest games.
-Each nation has its own fairly accurately represented style of architecture (Something very hard to see in other games, most games use the same re-skinned copy/paste models).
-Good World War I atmosphere.
-Good sounds and music which fits well in WWI period.
-In-game tutorial, commanding units, developing economy, using tactics and strategy.
-Five nations to choose (Austro-Hungarian Empire, Britain, France, Germany, Russia).
-Campaign for each nation and some extra missions.
-Skimrish mode against AI.
-Wide variety of units, buildings and technology.
-Specialized units that is specific of each country of the era.
-Challenging AI, playing on medium difficulty feels like hard, AI actually uses tactics
-In-game encyclopedia included (Museum) , which is good to have one.
-Would run smoothly on weak/old systems.

Neutral:
-No widescreen support (Not a big deal for me).
-No peace time option in skirmish mode like in Cossacks/American Conquest series.

Cons:
-Compatibility issues, the game is likely not going to run without problems on new hardware/Operating Systems, (works on my Win7 64-bit Laptop but not on my desktop PC with the same OS and superior hardware).

Overall the game is challenging and fun, I played years ago on Windows XP (outside of Steam), had issues too, but the one on Steam is (Gold) which is v2.0 so in theory it should work better than the old retail version, and that is true because I tried Disc version of The Entente: Battlefields World War I, and it didn't run on Windows 7 even with after patches.

I'm recommending the game to anyone who likes RTS and WWI, especially if you also like Cossacks/American Conquest series, but keep in mind the game might not work on every system, so think about the risk.

The game is fairly cheap, $1.99 in the US, 1,99‚Ç¨ in Europe, ¬£1.59 in UK and less in other countries, if you're a fan of RTS and old games then get it, you can keep it to play later on some weak system that is built for old games like me.

There are some tweaks and fixes that might fix your problems, don't forget to read pinned threads in the community hub, I would have not recommended the game if it was the same version as the old retail one, but this one (v2.0) actually worked on Win7 64-bit, unlike the retail version I have doesn't run, so if you really want to play this game then you have to give it a chance.

I'm guessing the problem is occurring from newer graphics cards and processors but graphics cards is my first guess.

My laptop specs: The Entente Gold" (Works).

HP G62

-Intel i5 460m
-First generation Intel HD Graphics
-4GB Ram
-Windows 7 64-bit Ultimate

My Desktop PC Specs: "The Entente Gold" (does NOT work).

-Intel i5-2500k
-GTX 770
-8GB Ram
-Windows 7 64-bit Ultimate

Cossacks and American Conquest series running perfectly out of the box on almost every known system (Except maybe Win8) I believe it is not hard to do the same for The Entente Gold.

I am kindly asking developers to release a patch to fix compatibility issues with various systems
date: please fix this game because it deserves more attention and fans.\n\nThe game is a hidden gem

reviewText:
Compatibility problems aside,The Entente Gold is a fine game for those who seek games related to The First World War.
All factions have uniquely modelled buildings and voicelines in their native language.
(Russians speak russian,Germans german,and the soliders of Austria-Hungary speak hungarian)
The levels are HUGE,which makes maneuvering with larger groups of soliders.
The game lets you controll almost two thousand men on map/player.
The soundtrack is memorable.
From the graphical standpoint,the game is plain mediocre,or even bad.(depends on how tolerant you are about graphics)
Overall,the game is worth picking at it's realtively low price of 1,99.
7.8/10

reviewText: Works just fine on my laptop (windows 7 64 bit, Geforce GT 540M, widescreen). Original version I had worked great on Windows 98, but used to crash terribly on Windows XP and flickered badly, this one works also has some minor flickering in menus, but nothing too serious. Widescreen support doesn't exist, but that's really not that much of a surprise. Multiplayer seems to be down, it was powered by GameSpy if I recall correctly, so it's not a surprise, I guess.\nFor those who have issues - install directx version suggested in forums, use compability mode and don't forget it's a game from era that is kinda hard to play on modern PCs without tweaking, as developer can't really give you a DOS BOX and just emulate old hardware.\nGameplay wise it's a great strategy surviving the trial of time well, especially when there are not that many WW1 strategies out here at all. It is lacking trench warfare so it's impossible to call it realistic, but otherwise amount of troops on screen and the variety of the game is really impressive.

reviewText:
The game runs on Windows 7. The menu flickers a bit like some old games do- I think it's a GDI problem or something. The resolutions you can choose are all 4:3, no widescreen, 1600x1200 is the top one, though I'm going from memory since the screenshots/steam overlay don't work.

When you start a game there's some really nasty graphic corruption on the screen- black blocks and/or tiles randomly in the wrong place. If you scroll the screen off then back again it fixes it though and doesn't seem to happen again in the level.

Levels are huge and there's buildings to make and resources, very much like in AoE,AoM etc.

reviewText:
The only reason I wouldn't recommend the game is it is really hit or miss as to whether or not you'll be able to get it operational on your system.

The game mechanics are alright, nothing mind blowing, and it plays very similar to Age of Empire in my limited play time.

I'm not going to sink anymore time into though, as I'm one of many who have an issue with the game not rendering some assets, mainly the buildings aren't visible for me. Others have issues like the game not even running, and while I normally take those kinds of complaints with a grain of salt, reading through the forum shows this game is rarely a simple install and play with everything working as expected.

If you're the patient type who doesn't mind doing some work arounds to get things operating as intended, and you like an Age of Empires type game, then give it a shot. Otherwise, stay away.

reviewText: Entente is one of those under rated games in my opinion. I played this a lot a few years back, and the entire Great War setting is something i feel needs more games. Not to the extent of World War 2, mind you. So graphicly, its old. I am currently running it on Vista, aside from a few annoyances the game runs fine. Even though the game is said to work on XP (and older) and 7. If you like games such as Cossacks (Cossacks two lovers, sorry its more like Cossack one) or American Conquest. Put some money down and play one of the finest World War 1 strategy games.

reviewText:
Well honestly, don't buy it. Unless for extreme nostalgia sake - which is why I got it. It's pretty broken. I loved this Entente when I was younger and loved playing it, one of the few World War 1 RTS games out there. The problem I have is this game uses FPS to judge game speed. If you want to run slowly you're going to have 12-18 frames per second. Not to mention the GUI. When up on your screen it halves the already poor frame rate.  It goes up to 35 frames if you turn the speed all the way up but then if you select a unit the menu appears and halves your framerate again.

The colours are disorientating and can making you feel sick after a good hour or so. The resolution is screwy at best. They are weird to begin with, I'm not sure but I think they're for 4:3 monitors. I'm going to say don't get it if you've just stumbled upon it and thought it seemed interesting.

If they just made a HD version that got rid of the resolution and framerate problems I would reccommend this game like crazy.

reviewText:
I bought this game on Steam to see if it's as bad as I remember.

It is.

Gameplay: I am familar with Cossacks, but this completely throws all sense of balance and playability out of the window. Campaign maps are just random blobs with very poor scripting, little of the objectives make sense.

Historical Accuracy: Laughable. Bears a passing resemblance to the 1st World War at best. No Trenches, campaign maps again bear no resemblance to reality, some ridiculous unit choices.

Media: The menus are graphically awful, and the music makes my ears bleed.

reviewText:
GAME DOES NOT WORK ON WINDOWS 7+!

It is unplayable on Windows 7+, and from my reading you can attempt to mitigate any problems by trying certain steps, but it is far from guaranteed. Developers seem not to be ready to actually fix it for popular consumption.

Because of the above, avoid the game until it gets a decent update to operate on Windows 7+, even if it costs $2.

reviewText:
What a pity! I know that I would enjoy playing this game but sad to say, it does not work in Windows 8.1 64-bit! Steam failed to fix this issue. I tried running in compatibility mode Windows XP, ran it as an administrator but it still would not work!

I should not recommend this game. However, I am recommending this game to players who have an older computer system. Besides, it is not fair not to recommend this game just because it is not suited for newer machines.

I just hope that Steam would fix this issue but I am hoping against hope.

reviewText: Its not often you find a WW1 RTS game. And the game realy does its best to look ww1. The game favors mass waved and turtle tactics. To new users, this can be a shock, especially when the enemy attacks with waves and waves of troops. Gameplay is reletively simple, infantry are you core guys, cavely are good scouts, and the rest support you infantyr and cavelry. Just like WW1. The music is interesting, though nothing to write home about. Armies are similar enough that no one army is overpowered, yet each army has a style that makes them unique.  Now, here comes the problem. This game is infamouse for not working on new systems. It is recommend to use an oldersystem with this game. If not, you may have to toy with the files in game. To some of you, this might be fun. To others, it can be hell. Another problem with this game is that, despite being ww1, there are no trenchs to be seen. Yes sad, but we can't have everything. Overall I would recomend this game. But Buyer Beware, be prepared for problems if you are using a new system. DEVS will not help you. Until a fan patch is made, best to play on an older system or find a home remedy to get the game to work.

reviewText: This is a quite challenging but still fun game in the old Command and Conquer" RTS vein
date: but with the level of historic detail it should be compared to the "Cossacks 2" series. The interface is fairly simple as are the graphics
recommended: but the visuals maintain the game's historic accuracy (the differences between national uniform). It can't be compared to the "Blitzkrieg" series for graphics
hoursPlayed: and it's somewhat behind the "Battle of Empires" mod for "Company of Heroes"
voteText: but for the price there's quite literally hours (if not weeks or even months in the campaigns) of game play with thankfully little frustration for the junior leader or even the veteran RTS player. A well-trained AI is built into the game to manage your civil or military war effort for you so you need do very little
helpfulPercent: unless you really want a challenge. Then you should fully expect General War in all his aspects! Finally and thankfully the game doesn't just park itself in trench warfare-you should expect what really happened in 1914; the dawn of twentieth-century warfare with all the associated horrors. Good luck

reviewText:
Go to Store (Featured), Click on Games, Narrow by Feature (Steam Trading Cards), Relevance (Lowest Price).
Then skip to Page 9 or 10, until you find the .50 - $1.00 games.
Add them to your Wishlist, games that are a dollar can go on sale and you may be able to purchase for cheap!
A game at .50 may give you that value back in trading cards.
Search and Install Idle Master" which will run your games even without the game being installed.

I may or may not ever play this game
date: but some games I have installed and messed around with on a rainy day!\n@ .50-$1.00 it's hard not to recommend!"
